Even after a wash, they remained soft, which is wonderful.<br /><br />I use them mainly for powder foundation, powder blush, and powder concealer. I don't like using brushes for liquid make-up - it's much better to pat them into your skin, as it provides a fresher, more radiant, and more natural-looking coverage.<br /><br />I can't recommend these brushes enough!!

This brush set is much much softer. If you're stuck between purchasing the Dragon brushes and these (like I was), I definitely recommend these over the Dragon brushes.   148. At first I was wary of ordering these because of some negative review, but I thought, &#34;it's not a bad price, so let's try them.&#34; I am so glad that I bought these! They are VERY soft and pick up product like a dream! The only issue I had was that they have an extremely strong chemical smell. I washed these brushes well with Cetaphil gentle skin cleanser and a dot of gentle laundry detergent. I let the soap mixture settle in the bristles well before rinsing them off. They still had a faint smell, but after using them once the smell is all gone.<br /><br />PROS:<br />1. Very affordable<br />2. Soft brushes<br />3. Picks up product well<br />4. Free 2 day ship for Amazon Prime users<br />5. Fit perfectly in my hands<br /><br />CONS:<br />1. Horrible smell (before washing)<br />2. The eyeshadow brushes are a bit big for my eyelids so I use them for blending or lightly dabbing on some eyeshadow (I mainly bought these brushes for the face and blush brushes.)<br /><br />I would definitely recommend these to people who are looking for affordable and soft variety of brushes!

  161. These brushes are seriously amazing. I didn't expect much upon ordering, just because of the price, but OH MY GOSH, they are great quality, so soft, and I had seen one brush shed upon washing, but nothing since then. They are dense, and the Kabuki flat top brush, applies my foundation so smoothly, and evenly and it doesn't absorb my product. There is hardly any foundation on the brush after use, it is all on my face. This beats the heck out of the Urban Decay foundation brush that I own.<br /><br />I use the smaller brushes to get underneath the eyes, contouring my nose, and under my lip. The flat top Kabuki is great for applying foundation, the slanted flat top kabuki is great for contouring, the more rounded out slanted brush, I use for blush, and it works great. The domed brush blends out concealer like no body's business. I will be purchasing a few more sets of these. I think they are great if you are a freelance makeup artist. For those complaining that they weren't labeled, or that they didn't come with instructions, it isn't that hard to look it up, but I had no issues, and I find them wonderful.

  310. They arrived 2 days after ordering with Amazon prime. When I got them I immediately opened the bag to check them out. I checked every single brush for shedding, smell, and to ensure the brush head was properly attached to the handle. I was surprised to find zero shedding and they are all strongly attached to the brush head. The do smell a little strong (chemical smell typical of synthetic materials) but I will wash them tonight and I am positive the smell will go away. They are super soft and I really like the big face brushes; not as dense as the MAC or Sigma kabuki but close enough. You really won't be able to tell the difference and the product will go on your face just the same. I am pleasantly surprised with this set and will recommend it to my friends who don't want to shed over $100.00 on a brush set like I did (Sigma Essential Kit for $170.00 anyone?)

I did not find these plastic sleeves to be suitable for long-term use or storage of these brushes and have found another method of storing them.<br /><br />To date, I have currently tried 5 out of the 10 brushes. I designated one for liquid foundation, one for loose powder, two for blushes, and one for concealer (smaller brush).<br /><br />So far, these brushes seem to be an excellent value for the price.<br /><br />The larger (Kabuki style) brushes are VERY soft and easy to work with. I was very impressed with the quality of the them. They pick up product very well, apply product smoothly and work great for blending. The handles are a great length and thickness to feel comfortable in my hand while applying makeup. I feel that this kit is worth the price just for these brushes.<br /><br />The smaller brushes are still quite soft, but not as soft as the larger brushes in this kit. They seem to be too small to apply my foundations and blushes, but too large to apply my eye shadows. The only use I have found for them so far is for my concealers (they do an okay job with applying concealers), although they may be good for contouring (and I plan to experiment with that at a later date). Currently I am not using these smaller brushes much.<br /><br />In total, the 5 brushes have shed maybe 2 hairs!<br /><br />I would purchase these brushes again for this price and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a less-expensive option to Kabuki style makeup brushes.

I was pleasantly surprised!<br /><br />There may have been a slight smell to them but I'm not someone bothered by scents. They are dense and so soft, and the best part is that they don't wiggle around at the base (if that makes sense). I've spent $38 on just one brush at a makeup store and it wasn't as sturdy feeling at these ones.<br /><br />The only downside to these is that I did notice a little shedding on my shirt when I was all done putting on makeup.<br /><br />I will update after these receive their first wash, but overall, I'm very happy with these. For the amount paid, they are a steal.

  538. So I will start off by saying that I did read other reviews before making this purchase, the good and the bad ones. I will say that the brushes themselves are extremely soft, so that was a plus for me. Upon reading some of the negative reviews I did read that these brushes did have a odor to them and most people could not get this to come out. For $10 dollars I was willing to give these brushes a try and see what I could do with them. I received them today in the mail and was very excited to try them out..<br /><br />Well, when I went to sniff them for myself to see if they did contain an odor...I can guarantee that with in the next hour I will have a headache. These brushes do contain an odor on each one of them, it is not the packaging. It's the actual bristles on the brushes. I washed one of the brushes out twice with two different products and the odor did decrease but it was still present. The odor is somewhat of paint mixed with gasoline. For this reason alone I will be returning these brushes and giving another set I will buy a go. When washing the brush out, only one or two bristles came out and that wasn't an issue for me, just the odor is. So be warned that these brushes do contain an odor.

There has been no fall out and they apply flawlessly. Easy to clean, which I have done with a spray daily and every other week with a brush shampoo and brush stand that dries them upside down to keep the water out of the glue. As for the smell when you first open them, I washed them before first use and the smell was gone. Just remember to dry them upside down!

  625. I like these brushes. They are very elegant-looking and they perform well. They have held up well with little to no shedding and they did not come apart, as some people have experienced. I find they are very well constructed and I didn't need to reinforce the brush head as some other reviewers did.<br />My only issue is that they seem to take a long time to dry after washing them. Usually letting my other brushes dry overnight is sufficient, but these need about 24 hours. Since I don't have a lot of brushes, but wear makeup often, this can be a challenge.

  773. This is an AMAZING deal for the price. I will say that since I only had 4 brushes before ordering these, I am still trying to figure out the different uses for all of them. The only reason that I have given this 4/5 stars is because the smaller brushes could stand to be a little bit more dense. This is mainly in regards to the flat top / stippling like brush that is meant for concealing blemishes. I find that the hairs are too long and bend to much to really pack the product on a problem spot. Also, as others have said, they do smell like paint but that scent wears off quickly. Also (since I'm being nit picky) a few hairs did shed from the big flat top brush from foundation, which isn't a huge deal as it has only happened during on application, BUT does make me hope that they will not quickly fall apart. Overall, I would definitely say if you are new to the brush world and aren't sure what you want/need, this is a great deal to get you started !

While washing them they did not come apart, for those who's brushes did you have to be washing them wrong, do not wet the entire brush and NEVER wash any makeup brushes upside down that causes the glue to weaken causing the brush to fall apart. Anyway, I have not used them on my face yet but running them across my arm, they are the softest brushes I've ever owned! I highly recommend these brushes they are very under priced for the quality.

I would honestly pay for the money I spent for this set just for the contouring brush alone.   991. NOTE: I purchased the Silver Black version of these brushes (still made by BS-MALL and sold by Sunlion Shop) found [[ASIN:B00KOW827M on this page]] (not the Golden Black ones listed here). I'm simply sharing my review of the BS-MALL brushes with photos.<br /><br />PROS:<br />1) I was happily surprised that none of the handles popped off while washing them.<br />2) Even more happy that I think I saw only 1 bristle come out while I washed all the brushes. I will say I like that the bristles are a very nice quality. For synthetic bristles they are very soft.<br />3) I previously had been using a MAC stippling brush that was black with white tips like these and EVERY time I washed it it would clean off the makeup and the water would turn blackish like the black dye was bleeding. I assumed this would happen with these if that happened for years with my MAC brush and NONE of these turned the water or my white towels black while they were drying.<br /><br />CONS:<br />1) Each brush was individually wrapped and I was astonished how much each one smelled like paint, I IMMEDIATELY washed them one by one, though the smell did go away after washing them :)<br />2) The brushes take a lot longer to dry than most any brushes I have used. I was really surprised they did not dry over night even after squeezing them out with a dry bamboo paper towel. I even went so far as to hang them upside-down to make sure water wouldn't sit in the metal base of the brush.<br />3) I wish the eyeshadow brushes were a little more unique. These brushes are great, but they are pretty similar to each other. They all look like different variations of brushes I would use to blend shadows - all very similar.<br /><br />1 handle came off but it honestly didn't bother me - I just paid $18 for one eyeliner brush at Sephora the other day and so even if a couple of these brushes had problems (which they don't) I still think they are a great set of brushes for such a low price. A little super glue and I went to hold them all and completely forgot which one I had just glued.<br /><br />***I REALLY LIKE how well you can see the amount of product on the brushes - see pic with product on brushes. The picture to the right of the brushes with blush & shadow on them is of the same 2 brushes just after wiping them off on a tissue with a little alcohol (not washed with soap & water).<br /><br />I would definitely purchase these brushes again or recommend them to friends.<br /><br />***UPDATE***<br />I recently got the [[ASIN:B0105NO4N0 BS-MALL(TM) 9pcs Premium Synthetic Cosmetics Eye Shadow Eyeliner Makeup Brushes Sets (9 Pcs Golden Black)]] since I wanted more unique eye shadow brushes and these are a great addition to the set listed on this page.   1023. Great weight, no fiber fallout, soft, dense and well constructed. As with all new brushes, soak and wash with brush cleaner or baby shampoo. The best advice I ever got about new brushes is to wash them really good. Especially before they are ever used. Smash them and give them a good workout. Show them who's boss. Pounce them as dry as you can on a paper towel. Leave upright to dry overnight. Mine withstood a vigorous workout. I still can't believe I got this set for $15. All I can say is if yours don't do the same, have them replaced or request money back. Mine are great!

  1038. I got these as a travel set to use as alternates to my tried-and-true Real Techniques brushes... and ended up actually preferring these more! They are so soft and dense, it's unbelievable. To give you an idea, when washing these I have to rinse twice as long as my other brushes to get all the shampoo out, and they also take twice as long to dry... that's how tightly packed the bristles are. Yet they're soft as little chinchillas. Really a pleasure to use.<br /><br />The pointed brush I find a bit awkward - too tapered for all-over application yet too large for precise usage. I prefer my Real Techniques blush brush, which is smaller. However, all the others I use daily. The large, flat tops are great for stippling on powder with a light hand, while the large rounded ones are perfect for buffing in foundation as well as blending out powders or creams. The small brushes work well for applying contour and highlight, or for blending out eyeshadow seamlessly - you'll still need some finer brushes for crease and liner applications, but these are great go-to brushes for larger work around the eyes.<br /><br />Careful not to store them in tight containers for a long time or the bristles will get a &#34;dent&#34; in them until washed and reshaped - may seem obvious, but because these are so dense they seem a bit less forgiving/malleable than other brushes.

The flat top brush is good for liquid foundation, but I find myself reaching for my previous foundation brush because this one is not as full as I would like it to be. The two rounded top small brushes are good for large applications of eyeshadow, but I rarely reach for the other two. I only use about half of the brushes from this set, but for the price if I had only found one I liked it would definitely be worth it. I haven't had any quality issues with the brushes, no shedding and no problems with the handles becoming loose. I would recommend washing these brushes before use, but be aware that they will take a long time to dry due to their density.

  1400. Soft brushes! Love these
  1401. I rarely write reviews, but I wanted to write one about this one because it's an awesome deal if you know how to properly care for inexpensive makeup brushes. I am somewhat of a beauty product aficionado and I have a lot of makeup brushes, both high end and inexpensive. These are really great! They are dense and shaped really well. I like the kabuki style brushes for foundation and cream products, which these are amazing for! The synthetic bristles make them very easy to clean as well.<br /><br />The downside with these brushes is that they aren't super well put-together. That is easily fixable though. You just need a hot glue gun and a pen (or pen-like object). Here's what I do:<br /><br />1) Wash them thoroughly. They do have that factory chemical smell that comes from all inexpensive brushes ordered from China. Let them dry.<br /><br />2) Separate the handle from the brush head. Yes, I separated the handle. These are not glued in well, so people who complain of the brushes breaking or the bristles coming out, this is why. Because there is not much glue holding them together, the handles will detach fairly easily.<br /><br />3) Put hot glue in the back side of the brush head. BE CAREFUL, THE METAL PART WILL GET HOT (I ADVISE USING GLOVES FOR THIS PART). Pour some hot glue in the back of the brush head and GENTLY pat it down with the pen. This will help secure the bristles a little better. Then put some hot glue around the rim of the brush head and quickly insert the handle. This will help secure the handle on more effectively.<br /><br />I did this with all of my brushes (and I have used this technique on other inexpensive brands as well) and it works well. Yes, it requires a little extra work to make these last long term, however for the price, I think it's worth it. The only other complaint I might have is that these soak up a lot moisture, so when you dry them after washing, try to dry them upside down. Otherwise, a great buy!
  1402. These brushes are amazing and super soft. The prize is great too. I'm glad I looked at reviews before buying because I am very happy about this buy.
  1403. I've never wrote a review and I online shop A LOT. Can I just say these brushes are AMAZING. They came packaged just fine. They're extremely soft and the flat top brush is my favorite to use for foundation. I do not have flawless skin but you would never be able to tell after I apply my makeup with these brushes.

When the smell disappears, you will be left with these amazing brushes that are very sturdy and so incredibly soft.   1414. At first I was skeptical of these but something told me to try them and I am so glad I did. These are 100% synthetic and are very dense in texture. They do have a strange smell when you first open them, but that is expected when they are synthetic. Just wash them before use (with an antibacterial soap and rinse well) and the smell is gone. You should always wash your brushes before use anyways so this did not bother me. They blend out foundations and powders flawlessly. I use them for foundation, powder, contour, blush, eyeshadow and everything in between and I plan on buying more for myself and as gifts.

  1589. Great price for these brushes. I got a silver set for my Daughter & a gold set for myself. We did have some handles come loose & fall off of 3 on one set & 4 on the other. There's a great review on top of here that will explain how you can easily fix this issue! A hot glue gun, & a bit inside and the handle will be tight on them forever! I knew this when I purchased them, so it wasn't a problem . For the price of these, the quality is great and you get a lot of different sizes, shapes. It's well worth it. But don't expect to pay $10-$12 for a bunch of decent quality brushes & get upset that the handles come loose. It's an easy cheap fix & you'll have great brushes for a few dollars!<br /> Like she said, when you get them, wiggle the handles until they come off & fix it permanently with the hot glue gun. That way your not in the middle of getting ready to go out, putting on your foundation, concealer and it comes off and your pissed! Lol -<br /> They are really soft, I've had NO shedding with either set. Or so minimal that I didn't take notice. They wash well, and dry nice and soft. Any loose hairs should come out when you wash them which should be done as soon as you get them & before you use them. I will be buying more sets to have, & in case the price goes up or they aren't around after. They are really great brushes and you can't , can't beat the price! I've bought expensive brushes where 1 eye brush was about $40, and I will never spend that money on brushes again! These are just as good ( after you fix the handles) and SO much cheaper! I will put my money towards great makeup that I use to spend stupidly on a few brushes because they say * MAC or * Sigma on them. Your paying them for the name & for the company to promote their products. These are Good, quality brushes where it really matters- the hairs that touch your face & put your makeup on. They don't soak up the foundation, it applies it to your skin & doesn't streak or micro exfoliate your skin as your rubbing and make it flake so your makeup isn't smooth. These are soft, but will stand up to any technique of applying foundation, powders, concealer, shadows etc.<br /> Spend your money on great makeup and save a lot on these gems.<br /> Love these. I've used liquid, all sorts of powders ( Ben nye loose, bare minerals, benefit) , pro cream foundation and concealer a ( Kett, Graftobian, Mehron) , also cream, powder blushes & highlighters and these brushes performed great with ALL of them.<br /> I recommend these highly, even with the small easy fix issue with the handles!<br /> Love and buying more sets...<br /> ( silver ones look just like my expensive brushes . I have to look for the name to tell. The gold is a bit cheaper looking, just the tone to me seams cheap looking. But they all perform the same , but I will be getting a few more sets and all in the silver. ) just in case anyone was choosing between colors- I'd stick with the silver. IMO<br /> Jenni~rubbing and make it flake so your makeup isn't smooth.   1603. I got my brushes today and they r great. Yes the smell is there but do yourself a favor and buy some Johnson & Johnson baby shampoo (the gold one) and wash your brushes as soon as you get them. In your palm swish the brush around run them under warm water and wash the handle Til suds appear. Then rinse n gently squeeze them out in a towel. And stand up with the handle side up to dry. As for falling apart from the handle I Dnt know that yet BUT I am going to get some pretty duct tape and tape my brushes because that gold is ugly haha. Any who they're soft and beautiful and they aren't really big. And if you know what to do with what brush it shouldn't be confusing but someone on here help with that of you don't know and you are just startin with makeup! Overall great brushes but make sure u wash them. Airing them out will do nothing.

Their website also provides a detailed description of each brush. I'm not comparing the two but I'm sure this will help someone who's trying to figure out which brush is which. It is synthetic so its going to smell like all synthetic brushes do but it eventually fades away.   1839. The brushes are soooo soft, yet dense. You can tell they're durable. At first they come with a weird smell, but after an hour airing out the smell disappears. One of the bigger brushes broke within twenty minutes of un packing. But this wasn't too much of a big deal to me I just added some crazy glue and stuck it back on, I tried to pull the other wood pieces off the gold handles and they wouldn't budge so I'm guessing it was just that one. If your having trouble guessing which one is for what just reference them with the sigma 10 piece brush set, these are identical! That's what I did, I labeled them with a p-touch but you can do it with paper tape and marker as well. Very happy with them.
  1840. I was kind of skeptic to buy this product because it was cheap, but I read the reviews so why not give it a try? I ordered these and these came in pretty quick! It smells weird at first, but that's because of the packaging. I made sure I washed my brushes and swiped a little bit of alcohol on the bristles before I used it on clients. I didn't get to use them on my face yet, but I have used it on clients. Everyone said that the bristles are extremely soft so yay for that! If you don't know what's the difference of a regular face brush and a synthetic face brush, a regular face brush usually absorbs the foundation/concealer (which is not really good because you waste more foundation) whereas a synthetic brush grabs the foundation and leaves it on the surface of the bristles. The application is absolutely flawless and I'm very pleased with this since these brushes are cheap compared to MAC and sephora. The smaller brushes are great for contouring, highlighting, and putting powder. My only con is that the larger face brushes are so hard to clean if you use a liquid/heavy cream foundation. I can clean the smaller brushes with a daily brush spray. I usually have to deep cleanse the larger ones for the foundation to come out, but I really don't mind it. I have the patience for it. Overall, I think it's worth to buy.

These cosmetic brushes (when they arrived each brush was individually protected by a plastic slip) are of an amazing quality, and within my second week of using them, I have yet to see barely any hairs fall out or any other product damage otherwise. If you're on a budget like me and refuse to blow so much money on high - end, brand name brushes for quadruple the price, stop your search right here because these brushes are your answer. They carry and disperse your makeup products evenly, the hairs have a perfect combination of flexibility and stiffness, and you get a variety of brushes for several purposes (blush, bronzer, concealer, setting powder, etc.) I am so happy with this product, A+.

  1977. I showed this brush to my MUA cousin, and she said it was very good quality and very comparable to the Sigmax essential brush kit for $150! If she didn't know better, she'd think it was sigma brushes! She's thinking of ordering one for herself!<br />The only downside is the smell. But after a couple days airing it out, it's gone!<br />Also, when you wash your brushes, make sure the water doesn't get past the metal handle because that loosens up the glue and breaks it apart.<br />Since the brushes are so dense, it dries for a long time when on the side. I bought a brush drying rack and dry it upside down with the bristles facing down. Now, I wash it at night, it's dried and ready to use in the morning.<br />Hope this helps!

  2072. The brushes are soft and quite dense, but they don't seem to give phenomenal color payoff, particularly for powders like blush and eyeshadow. I do like the large flat-top brush for blending cream contours in a hurry, but I feel like a good amount of product is taken off my face and absorbed by the brush. The eyeshadow brushes are a bit big for practical application other than all-over lid coverage. Also, there is definitely a chemical smell, but it seems to go away with time and washing. Nothing too unbearable, at least on my brushes. All that said, for the price they're a pretty good deal, and I'm sure I'll find use for most of them at some point or another. Ultimately happier with my MAC, Ecotools, Chanel, and Sephora brushes, but those were moderately to much pricier. These do, however, rank much better than my e.l.f. brushes (about on par, if not cheaper, price-wise).

I did notice that the brushes shed just a little bit and some of the bristles were uneven. I fixed the brushes with hot glue and trimmed the long bristles after they dried. Now that the brushes are fixed I am enjoying them very much. I have used them every time I apply makeup. Overall for the price these brushes are a good buy; if you do not mind taking the time to add hot glue to the bristles inside of the ferrule and applying some glue along the inside top portion of the ferrule. (I got this idea from one of the other reviews I read about this product).

If you want a more precisely done eye look, these brushes won't work as well for that purpose. All of these brushes are super soft, comparable to my Sephora and Real Techniques brushes :) These shipped at a good speed too, around 4 days. The only complaint I have is the strong, chemical smell after opening the packaging; it does go away significantly after you wash them, but the plastic smell still lingers a little.   2227. NEW POST:<br />A few months ago I posted a comment on how much I loved these brushes, however, things have definitely changed. The first set of brushes that I received several months back were wonderful. They had an incredible handle and the bristles were spectacular. I decided to order a new set of brushes because I loved them so much and I have to say that I'm thoroughly disappointed. The new set of brushes have a substantially smaller handle, the metal is thin and so are the bristles. I don't know if BS-MALL decided to change manufacturing in order to cut costs, but it didn't work in their favor. I hardly use my new brushes and I have to say that I wish they would've stated that they changed the way they are made. Many of you are probably thinking that I should expect this from brushes that are less than $20 dollars. However, if any of you tried the brushes before the change many of you could agree that the quality definitely went down. I would've easily compared these brushes to the Sigma line or MAC, but now I would honestly compare the larger facial brushes to something that you received with a L'oreal compact powder. The reason I gave it three stars is because I do like the eye brushes. They bristles are perfect for blending, and that's about it. Many of the brushes don't hold in the product very well, however, they blend colors beautifully. I really hope that this company decides to go back to their old methods because these brushes we're the only ones I would ever buy. Now, I just want to ask for my money back.<br /><br />OLD POST:<br />Let me start off by saying that when it comes to makeup I've owned almost every brush that there is to own. Each set is different from the last, however, you know the good ones because their still in your cabinet. These brushes are spectacular. I wear makeup every single day and I can be fairly hard on my brushes. I have a tendency to forget to clean them and most of them travel with me wherever I go. I must say, I've only used these brushes for powdered products. The bristles are tightly fitted together and the feel of these brushes are soft and perfect for applying any type of makeup. My two personal favorite brushes are the angled contour brush and the brush that resembles a cone and I must say that they are dreamy to use. The eye brushes work just as well. This is one of those products that I would highly suggest stocking up on because having these amazing brushes for this price isn't going to last long. These are the must have brushes for anyone to have, wether you are just starting off with makeup or you've been doing it your whole life. These brushes will not let you down.or powdered products.
